* A buildup of fecal waste remains was observed on the cement floor in two enclosures. Four dogs are in contact with the
affected surfaces located in the outdoor attached runs to sheltered housing. The affected area covers approximately 25 to
30 percent of the total wall surface. It indicates an unsanitary living condition exists that could lead to a potential disease
or health risks. Spot cleaning affected surfaces daily and sanitization of all surfaces is necessary to prevent an
accumulation of excreta and other disease hazards. The licensee must ensure that all surfaces are spot cleaned daily and
sanitized at least once every two weeks or more often if needed in accordance with section 3.11 B to help prevent an
accumulation of excreta and reduce disease hazards. Correct by 4/6/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
